translated: Nineteenth Section🔽Discourse on the Fruits of Recluseship

original: Nibbānaṁ tāṇaṁ leṇaṁ saraṇaṁ parāyaṇaṁ accutaṁ amatanti?
analyzed: nibbānam tāṇam leṇam saraṇam parāyaṇam accutam
translated: “Is Nibbāna the refuge, the shelter, the resort, the recourse, the final ally?”
“Is the fruit of recluseship unformed, and is Nibbāna unformed?”
“Are there two refuges …🔽are there two shelters …🔽are there two resorts …🔽are there two recourses …
“Is the state of a recluse unformed?”
“Is the state of a recluse formed?”
The fruit of arahantship is unconditioned?”
“The path to the fruit of arahantship is unconditioned?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“The path to the fruit of arahantship is conditioned?”

analyzed: arahatta phalam  na ha ivam vattabbe pe

translated: “The fruit of stream-entry is unconditioned, and the fruit of once-returning …
the fruit of arahantship and Nibbāna are unconditioned?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

analyzed: āmantā  pañca tāṇāni pe  antarikā vāti
translated: “Yes.”🔽“Are there five shelters, five places to stay, five abodes, five kinds of sensual stimulation, and five kinds of inner space?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
The Discussion of the Fruits of Asceticism is finished.
